title: [ICE] with const generics without feature

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-stable
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from one stable version to another.

body:
```rust
fn foo<const N: usize>(x: &[u8; N]) -> &[u8; N - 1] {
    match x { [_, ref xs @ ..] => xs }
}
fn main() {}
```

Gives:

```rust
error[E0658]: const generics are unstable
 --> ...\test.rs:1:14
  |
1 | fn foo<const N: usize>(x: &[u8; N]) -> &[u8; N - 1] {
  |              ^
  |
  = note: see issue #74878 <https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/74878> for more information
  = help: add `#![feature(min_const_generics)]` to the crate attributes to enable

error: internal compiler error: compiler\rustc_middle\src\ty\subst.rs:568:17: const parameter `N/#0` (Const { ty: usize, val: Param(N/#0) }/0) out of range when substituting substs=[]

thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box<Any>', /rustc/1700ca07c6dd7becff85678409a5df6ad4cf4f47\compiler\rustc_errors\src\lib.rs:904:9
stack backtrace:

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md

note: rustc 1.50.0-nightly (1700ca07c 2020-12-08) running on x86_64-pc-windows-gnu

query stack during panic:
#0 [eval_to_allocation_raw] const-evaluating + checking `foo::{constant#1}`
#1 [eval_to_const_value_raw] simplifying constant for the type system `foo::{constant#1}`
#2 [eval_to_const_value_raw] simplifying constant for the type system `foo::{constant#1}`
#3 [check_item_well_formed] checking that `foo` is well-formed
#4 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate
end of query stack
error: aborting due to 2 previous errors

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0658`.
```
